page.title: 01A PART OF WEST SOMERSET
page.content: Our block consists of most of Langford Budville,and a portion of Milverton. It is surrounded by hills on all sides and is situated in the foothills of Exmoor.The block is in the western border parts of Somerset.There are no towns or cities in our block,but there are three main villages.All of the area is rural with many farms.Farming is the most common source of income. There is dairy,arable and mixed farming.Livestock consists of cows, sheep and pigs.There are fields from 3 to 35 acres.In these all sorts of crops are grown from grass to pears. There are 7 large mansions,some private.Heathfield is a large wood made up of small woods.This common land belongs to the public and is used by them to graze their flocks.Our block is in a very beautiful part of Western Somerset.
